nodes.label: C3 Photosynthesis
nodes.description: Photosynthetic pathway utilized by rice, characterized by the inefficiency of Rubisco, leading to photorespiration and energy loss.

nodes.label: Rubisco Enzyme
nodes.description: Key enzyme in C3 photosynthesis with a slow catalytic rate and oxygenase activity, contributing to inefficiencies in rice.

nodes.label: Photorespiration
nodes.description: Process occurring in C3 plants where oxygen is fixed instead of carbon dioxide, leading to energy loss.

nodes.label: C4 Photosynthesis
nodes.description: More efficient photosynthetic pathway found in plants like maize and sorghum, concentrating CO2 around Rubisco to enhance yields.

nodes.label: International C4 Rice Consortium
nodes.description: Collaborative group focused on engineering C4 photosynthesis into rice to improve yields and resource efficiency.

nodes.label: Gene Transfer
nodes.description: Process of identifying and transferring genes responsible for C4 photosynthesis into rice.

nodes.label: Water Use Efficiency
nodes.description: Measure of how effectively a plant uses water during photosynthesis, improved in C4 plants.

nodes.label: Nitrogen Use Efficiency
nodes.description: Measure of how effectively a plant utilizes nitrogen, enhanced in C4 photosynthesis.

nodes.label: Yield Improvement
nodes.description: Increase in crop production, targeted by engineering C4 traits into rice.

nodes.label: Sorghum
nodes.description: Model species used for studying C4 traits and gene identification.

nodes.label: Setaria viridis
nodes.description: Model species utilized in mutagenesis and activation tagging to study C4 photosynthesis.

nodes.label: Vein Density
nodes.description: Density of vascular tissue in leaves, crucial for C4 photosynthesis and a target for modification in rice.

nodes.label: Chloroplast Distribution
nodes.description: Arrangement of chloroplasts in leaf cells, important for efficient photosynthesis and a challenge in C4 rice development.

nodes.label: Metabolite Transport Mechanisms
nodes.description: Processes involved in the transport of metabolites necessary for photosynthesis, requiring enhancement in C4 rice.

nodes.label: Gene Identification
nodes.description: Process of discovering genes associated with C4 traits through genomic and transcriptional approaches.

nodes.label: Anatomical Modifications
nodes.description: Changes required in leaf structure to support C4 photosynthesis in rice, including vein density and cell specialization.

nodes.label: Biochemical Modifications
nodes.description: Alterations in biochemical pathways necessary for the implementation of C4 photosynthesis in rice.

nodes.label: Evolution of C4 Pathway
nodes.description: Independent evolution of C4 photosynthesis over 60 times in various plant taxa, showcasing its adaptive significance.

nodes.label: Warm Semi-Arid Conditions
nodes.description: Environmental conditions under which C4 plants exhibit superior performance compared to C3 plants.

nodes.label: Prototype C4 Rice
nodes.description: Initial version of rice engineered to exhibit C4 traits, feasible with current genetic tools.

nodes.label: Complex Anatomy of C4 Plants
nodes.description: Intricate leaf structure of C4 plants that poses challenges for replication in rice.

edges.label: Rubisco is the key enzyme in C3 photosynthesis
C4 photosynthesis enhances water use efficiency
C4 photosynthesis improves nitrogen use efficiency
C4 Rice Consortium focuses on gene transfer
Sorghum is used for gene identification
Setaria viridis is used for gene identification
Vein density is an anatomical modification target
Chloroplast distribution is an anatomical modification target
C4 pathway has evolved independently in various taxa
C4 plants perform better under warm semi-arid conditions
Prototype C4 rice requires biochemical modifications
Complex anatomy of C4 plants presents challenges for modifications
